greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Reversion of g.f. (with constant term included) for partition numbers.
comment: See A301624 for the corresponding series reversion for the plane partition numbers A000219. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 09 2020
link: P. Bala, Representing a sequence as [x^n] G(x)^n
Index entries for reversions of series
formula: The o.g.f. A(x) = 1 - x + 2*x^3 - 3*x^4 + 5*x^6 - ... satisfies [x^n](1/A(x))^n = sigma(n) = A000203(n) for n >= 1. - _Peter Bala_, Aug 23 2015
G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = Product_{k>=1} (1 - x^k*A(x)^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 21 2018
maple: Gser := solve(series(x*exp(add(sigma[1](n)*x^n/n, n = 1..35)), x) = y, x):
mathematica: Do[A[x_] = Sum[a[k] x^k, {k, 0, n}] /. sol; eq = CoefficientList[A[x] - Product[ 1 - x^k*A[x]^k, {k, 1, n}] + O[x]^(n + 1), x] == 0 /. sol; sol = sol ~Join~ Solve[eq][[1]], {n, 1, nmax}];
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 25 2001
